pullRequest.body:
Adds `not_lt_iff_not_le_or_ge` to produce `not_lt` in complement of `not_lf` and `not_le`.

---

nodes.body: messageFile.md

a) This should not be a `simp` lemma
b) Once the definition of `LF` is unfolded, this just gives `¬ x < y ↔ ¬ x ≤ y ∨ y ≤ x`. You should be able to prove this for preorders in general, can you do that?

> b) Once the definition of `LF` is unfolded, this just gives `¬ x < y ↔ ¬ x ≤ y ∨ y ≤ x`. You should be able to prove this for preorders in general, can you do that?

If so, would it be best to keep this `not_lt` theorem?
You can keep it for now. But I do plan in the future to remove `LF`, or at least keep it only as a notation for `¬ y ≤ x`.

:v: LeoDog896 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Sorry, I had missed this improvement.
bors d+
Sorry, I had missed this improvement.
bors d+

Is there a better name for this? I used _ge_ here as this can be rewritten as `a >= b`, but I don't believe that's the correct naming scheme. I wasn't able to find a good example to base the name off, though.
I think it's fine using `ge` when it refers to the opposite order relation to one which is also included in the theorem statement.
I don't really think we need a decidable version of this.

:+1: (This isn't an argument for having a decidable version of this, but I'm curious why it wouldn't be a good idea for this case. Is it because it introduces a new namespace when no other lemmas that require decidability exist?)

I think this should work:
```suggestion
  rw [lt_iff_le_not_le, not_and_or, Classical.not_not]
```
Otherwise LGTM.
This imports `Mathlib.Logic.Basic`. It seems to only import the 1000 lines in the file, and the rest are just tactics - I'm unsure if that's a 'good' large import in mathlib4.
In any case your original proof avoids this large import issue, so I retract my suggestion. Hadn't noticed this file was so early!

```suggestion
protected theorem not_lt {x y : PGame} : ¬ x < y ↔ y ⧏ x ∨ y ≤ x := not_lt_iff_not_le_or_ge
```
It seems to me that this would fit better early in Order/Basic?
Agreed. I'm unfamiliar with the Order section of Mathlib, but that seems more appropriate.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(SetTheory/Order/Basic): not_lt_iff_not_le_or_ge
